alert.note: Alert for Schuyler; Seneca; Yates (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 13 at 3:19PM EDT until March 15 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 9 inches in elevations below 1300 feet...and 8 to 12 inches above 1300 feet. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Yates, Seneca and Schuyler counties. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 8 AM EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates could approach 1 to 2 inches per hour late tonight into tomorrow. Gusty winds will cause reduced visibilities near open fields due to blowing snow tomorrow. Light snow will taper off Wednesday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
